title: Experiments implementing small commuting models lack gravitational features
author: Bryce Kobrin
excerpt: Nature - Experiments implementing small commuting models lack gravitational features
text: Matters Arising Published: 23 July 2025 Nature volume 643, pages E17–E19 (2025)Cite this article Subjects arising from: D. Jafferis et al. Nature https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-022-05424-3 (2022).The holographic correspondence posits that certain quantum mechanical Hamiltonians are dual to quantum theories of gravity1,2,3. A recent article by Jafferis et al.4 claims to experimentally realize this correspondence by demonstrating gravitational teleportation by means of an emergent traversable wormhole5,6,7,8,9,10. Unfortunately, we find that the Hamiltonian in Jafferis et al.4 does not satisfy two of the stated criteria for gravitational physics: it does not thermalize and the teleportation signal does not resemble traversable wormhole behaviour. Moreover, a third feature of gravitational systems—perfect size winding—appears to be satisfied only because the Hamiltonian implemented in Jafferis et al.4 is fully commuting, which is the exact property that leads to non-thermalizing behaviour. Subjects

arising from: D. Jafferis et al. Nature https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-022-05424-3 (2022).

The holographic correspondence posits that certain quantum mechanical Hamiltonians are dual to quantum theories of gravity1,2,3. A recent article by Jafferis et al.4 claims to experimentally realize this correspondence by demonstrating gravitational teleportation by means of an emergent traversable wormhole5,6,7,8,9,10. Unfortunately, we find that the Hamiltonian in Jafferis et al.4 does not satisfy two of the stated criteria for gravitational physics: it does not thermalize and the teleportation signal does not resemble traversable wormhole behaviour. Moreover, a third feature of gravitational systems—perfect size winding—appears to be satisfied only because the Hamiltonian implemented in Jafferis et al.4 is fully commuting, which is the exact property that leads to non-thermalizing behaviour.
